newsitem.title: USA: HEARTLAND Community to become stock savings bank.
newsitem.headline: HEARTLAND Community to become stock savings bank.

text.p: HEARTLAND Community Bank FSB said Tuesday it has has received approval from the Office of Thrift Supervision to convert from a federally chartered mutual savings bank to a federally chartered stock savings bank, and will sell two million shares of common stock in connection with the conversion.
The bank said it has formed a holding company, HCB Bancshares Inc, to hold its outstanding capital stock.
HCB said that certain account holders and borrowers of HEARTLAND Community Bank will have an opportunity to by the stock, at $10 per share, through a subscription offering closing April 23.
Shares that are not subscribed for during the subscription, said the bank, may be offered to the general public in a community offering, with first preference given to certain Arkansas residents.
